title: What does it mean if I see a message indicating that Android is being updated when I turn on my phone?
answer: When a continuous integration tool deploys an updated installation package for an app, it may deploy 32-bit and 64-bit versions at the same time. For normal app installation packages, the mode of operation (32-bit or 64-bit) is usually fixed in the production version. However, if your phone tries to optimize the operation mode when the system restarts, the message indicating that Android is being updated may appear. This is normal.
